reviews.review_msg: This prof is horrible, I would recommend that you not take classes with this prof, you will regret it. The class is difficult, and the prof is so biased. He does not even care about you.

I think he has changed the way he teaches by A LOT! I started doing better in the class when I focused on his lecture slides which saved so much time from the textbook. He practically gives you everything you should know/study for the exams on the modules provided.
Long lectures, I feel like I understand the words he says but I don't understand what he is saying. Midterm questions were vague and nothing like study questions. Just horrible
The whole term, I've felt like he is speaking a different language. I beg you. Don't do this to yourself.

NO. He cannot teach I'm sorry not trying to be rude but I sit in a 3 hour lecture not understanding a word he says. One of the worst classes I have taken at SFU by far. If you can, avoid taking 310 with him, trust me I'm trying to help. SFU is trying to sabotage our GPAs by letting him teach this course to undergrad students.
so much memorization for exams but the labs were pretty easy. the weekly quizzes could be tricky but not too bad. the exams were very difficult

Class itself honestly isn't that bad. I found that making notes for the textbook and watching the lecture slides after really helped to cut down what you needed to know. However, I found that assignments were graded very harshly and marks were docked off if you missed even the slightest detail.

Get ready to read 90% of the textbook to do well on assignments and exams. Lecture slides are long and boring. BPK 105 goes into extreme detail about different systems within the human body. TA is a tough grader as well, you'd meet all the criteria on assignment rubrics and still get marks docked for missing something unrelated to the question.

this class is not suited for online teaching. weekly lectures consist of 120 powerpoint slides, 80% of which have an 2-3 minute audio attachment that has no playback speed control. takes forever to take notes, i dont understand why its not been recorded and posted on youtube or zoom.

Voice is kinda dull so it was easy to zone out, but always tried to elaborate on stuff to be engaging and never just read off his slides. Had iClicker for attendance and participation to encourage ppl to show up. Grading was spread out over a lot of things. No complaints about Ryan, I just disliked the course itself. Lots of content and terminology

TBH. RUN. Take it with Jim carter. Ryan only talks about his kids, very monotone and puts u to sleep. The TAs for this course are always hit or miss. Im a bpk major and tbh now i wanna transfer out because ryan was awful. Very vague abt exams, rude and not worth it. Jim carter was a guest for a lecture. I learned more from Jim in one lesson.
Awesome professor. Answers all the questions and is pretty nice. Study hard and read all the lecture slides!

Professor Dill is not a bad prof himself, however, bpk105 coursework is challenging. It is textbook-heavy, to Ace exams you practically have to memorize everything on the pages of the textbook assigned. If you aren't good with memorization, I wouldn't recommend it. The topics go into EXTREME DETAIL about each of the body systems! not an elective!!!

I LOVED this course and Dr. Dill's lectures! Note, lectures are heavy 70-90 slides and all slides are examable. Make time to go through the lecture to prep for exams, and understand the concepts to allocate time to memorize the nuances and details (which are on the exams). Make time to review the anatomy portion every week and you'll be okay.

Ryan is a pretty cool guy who can come off a bit strong. Loves to relate content to his experiences in the field. I mostly enjoyed his course, but 3hr lectures were LONG and lots of information (reflected on exams). Will put you/a group on the spot in class to answer questions. Super helpful in office hours (esp. w/assignments). Reasonable grading.

He is a very tough marker, as you were docked for minor spelling mistakes. Lots of mesmerization as both the lectures and labs were heavy. Would not recommend taking it with him unless you are planning to study a lottttttttt.

Ryan is very good at lecturing and explaining concepts. However, he rarely replies to emails, and his exam answer keys are COMPLETELY unfair. Your answer could be completely right, but he will mark it wrong because it isn't his exact wording on the slides. The content is hard, and that's not his fault. BUT he could be a little more understanding.

Very tough course. It starts off easy then gets really hard.. don't bother watching his lecture recordings because they're boring, repetitive and super long. I learnt way more from teaching myself the learning outcomes using youtube lol. Assignments are also really easy if u understand. I averaged 100% on them and it's 20% of the final grade.
tough.

I wish he would use lecture slides that were pre-recorded instead of having students learn from a huge textbook.  It felt impossible to learn everything in this course. Please avoid this course if you don't need it. It definitely is not an elective, and should be more straight forward, especially as a 100-level course.
